alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 1:00PM EDT until July 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Missisquoi River Near North Troy affecting Orleans County. For the Missisquoi River...including North Troy, East Berkshire, Swanton...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Missisquoi River near North Troy. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Water will continue to inundate River Road between Troy and North Troy, as well as portions of Loop Road in Westfield and Troy, portions of Route 100 near Troy, and well upstream near Lowell. Widespread flooding of lowlands, fields, and pastures along the Missisquoi from Lowell to North Troy will continue until the river level falls below 9 feet tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...The observed maximum river stage of 13.2 feet is the 5th highest crest in history. This is just lower than what was observed during Tropical Storm Irene where the stage reached 13.94 feet on 8/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
